This course is presented in English!
Select activity Zoom link for online lectures
The course deals with the aerodynamics of
, which either move along the ground (e.g. automobiles, trucks, trains) or lie
stationary in the path of a flow (e.g. buildings). Environmental aerodynamics are also concidered.
- Fundamental mechanisms for lift and drag of automobiles.
- Aspects to the design of automobiles taking into account the flow around and through the body.
- Overview of numeric and experimental methods of investigation.
- Introduction of the aerodynamics of high-speed trains
- Introduction to aerodynamics of buildings and environment
Experiments with a 25% scaled car model will be carried out in the large wind tunnel of the TU-Berlin.
